Visited upon recommendation of a college friend (a NYT food critic), and I'm sure glad I took her advice (she steered me away from Adria's Tickets, which is oft-criticized for its pretentiousness).  Michelin stars, check.  Flawless service, check.  Amazing food, check.  Was it the most amazing fine dining meal I've ever had?  Not quite.  Those honors still go to Le Bernardin and Per Se in NYC.  But AbAC definitely lived up to the hype.  I opted for the chef's tasting menu (pricey at 125 euro, but I was on vacation, plus it's par for the course for this level of cuisine/service), along with a customized wine pairing with the sommelier's help.  Staff is fantastic, helpful, fluent in English, and not at all overbearing or pretentious, which is a plus.  Worth going out of the way to visit when you're in Barcelona, especially if there's a special occasion.
